intro.text: The Olympic Camp is a unique opportunity for young football enthusiasts to experience an immersive experience in the world of football. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced player, our camp is designed to provide a stimulating and fun learning environment.

about.title: About - Olympique Pozna≈Ñ
about.metaDescription: Discover the history and values of Olympique Pozna≈Ñ, a training football club in the heart of Pozna≈Ñ

intro.text: Located in the heart of the dynamic city of Pozna≈Ñ, Olympique Pozna≈Ñ is much more than just a football club: it's a true school of life, a place where passion, training and team spirit come together to shape tomorrow's talents.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.description: Quality training with certified and passionate coaches since 2023

teamSpirit.title: Team spirit
teamSpirit.description: A friendly and inclusive atmosphere where every player finds their place

passion.title: Passion
passion.description: Football as a vector for personal and collective development

training.title: Training
training.description: Programs adapted to each age for harmonious progression

excellence.title: Training focused on excellence
excellence.text1: Since its creation in 2023, Olympique Pozna≈Ñ has quickly established itself as a reference in the local sports landscape. The club takes pride in offering quality supervision, with certified and passionate coaches who accompany each player in their technical, tactical and personal development.
excellence.text2: Training programs are designed to meet the specific needs of each age group, thus promoting harmonious and adapted progression.

coaches.title: A dedicated coaching team
coaches.text1: Participants are supervised by the qualified coaching staff of Olympique Pozna≈Ñ. All of our coaches hold UEFA A, UEFA B or UEFA C licences, and also have football coaching/educator qualifications, with experience gained through internships and collaborations with renowned clubs. Our staff also includes specialists in strength & conditioning, as well as two goalkeeping coaches, ensuring high-level individual development.
coaches.text2: Our motto is: ‚Äúthe individual development of every player within the team‚Äù ‚Äî meaning each participant receives guidance tailored to their level, needs and potential.

atmosphere.title: A friendly and inclusive environment
atmosphere.text1: Olympique Pozna≈Ñ is an open and welcoming club. We build a culture based on respect, teamwork and fair play, where every player can feel confident and enjoy football.
atmosphere.text2: Diversity is one of our strengths: our club represents around 15 nationalities, and nearly half of our members are girls and women. Many of our sessions are mixed-age and mixed-gender (girls and boys), designed to strengthen integration and the true spirit of community.

community.title: Join our community
community.intro: Follow us on our social networks to not miss any club news, training photos, player testimonials and much more!

cta.text: Whether you're a young football enthusiast, a parent looking for a training club for your child, or simply a sports fan wanting to get involved in a dynamic community,
cta.textBold: Olympique Pozna≈Ñ welcomes you with enthusiasm.

coaches.title: Our Coaches - Olympique Pozna≈Ñ
coaches.metaDescription: Discover the team of passionate and qualified coaches at Olympique Pozna≈Ñ

intro.title: Our Coaching Team
intro.description: Passionate professionals dedicated to our players' development

stephane.name: ST√âPHANE WUTEZI
stephane.tagline: Architect and pillar of the club, master of organization, passionate coach

formations.title: Training courses, workshops, licenses obtained
formations.stages: Internships at: Tours FC, Stade Rennais FC, GKS Dopiewo, Warta Pozna≈Ñ
formations.conferences: Active participation in conferences, workshops and training on coaching, physical preparation and tactical aspects

idol.title: Childhood idol and current favorite player
idol.text: Thierry Henry ‚Äì "On an exterior wall of the Emirates Stadium, you can read: I fell in love with Arsenal because of Ian Wright. It's a quote from Thierry Henry, my idol since his beginnings at AS Monaco, when he was still just a teenager". Today: Miles Lewis-Skelly ‚Äì "I've always been fascinated by teenagers entering the world of professional football."

passion.title: Other passion than football: MUSIC
passion.text: "I'm a music lover. Surprisingly, my first passion is music. I 'devour' astronomical quantities of albums every week, from hip-hop to classical music. Every week, I must discover at least two new artists. Streaming platforms are fed up with me because I skew their statistics" üòä

questions.title: Want to know more about Coach St√©phane? Our players asked him a few questions üòä

q1.question: Where does the club name come from?
q1.answer: Olympique de Marseille and Olympique Lyonnais are among the most recognized French clubs on the international scene. By creating a club with French DNA, a French philosophy of youth training, which would play in the former Olimpia Pozna≈Ñ stadium ‚Äì a club that also wore the tricolor colors ‚Äì this name was a natural choice. Be careful though: Olympique is not Olimpia. Olympique is pronounced [Olƒôpik] üòä

q2.question: Why Poland?
q2.answer: My neighbor in university residence in Brittany cooked strange and exotic dishes in the shared kitchen. Out of curiosity, I approached her talking about "Lesz Posnan" and "Lesz Waleza" ‚Äì that's how you pronounce it in French, right? Thanks to love, I now know how to pronounce them correctly. Twenty years have passed, I live in Poland, this neighbor has become my wife, vice-president of the club, mother of two Olympic players and still the love of my life ü•∞

q3.question: Why is Arsenal your favorite club?
q3.answer: As a Parisian, I attended several matches at the Parc des Princes. In 1994, Arsenal won a European cup by beating PSG in the semi-final. They had Ian Wright in attack, a club icon, who wore the legendary red jersey with the number 8 and the JVC sponsor on the front. I was 10 years old and "I fell in love with Arsenal thanks to Ian Wright".

formations.title: Training courses, workshops and licenses obtained
formations.goalkeeper: Coaching internship at the Greater Poland Goalkeeper Academy (assistant)
formations.uefa: Currently preparing to follow UEFA C and GOALKEEPER A training

idol.title: Childhood idol and current favorite player
idol.text: Ronaldinho (FC Barcelona) "A football magician, thanks to him a smile never left my face during matches. Technically superior to all others of his era" and ≈Åukasz Fabia≈Ñski "Being a goalkeeper myself, I can only choose him. A wonderful and humble boy, who reached many peaks through hard work."

questions.title: Here are three short questions asked by the players üòä

q1.question: What does the coach appreciate most in a player? According to him, what is most important: talent or work?
q1.answer: What I appreciate most are the character traits that reveal what type of player you are. Talent is only a small part of success in sport, it must be reinforced by hard work to succeed. Great examples are Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo. So, without hesitation: hard work.

q2.question: What would you have liked to learn in your childhood, but never had the opportunity?
q2.answer: I would have liked to learn to play the guitar.

q3.question: If you could teleport anywhere in the world, where would you go and why?
q3.answer: I've always dreamed of Iceland, for its hot thermal waters, its magnificent landscapes, where you can bathe and jump directly into the snowy mountains!

patryk_w.name: PATRYK WESO≈ÅOWSKI
patryk_w.tagline: Specialist in work between the posts

formations.title: Training courses, workshops and licenses obtained
formations.reissa: Coaching internship at Reissa Football Academy
formations.conferences: Continuous improvement through participation in specialized training and conferences

idol.title: Childhood idol and favorite player today
idol.text: Ronaldo Nazario. "Always the same. He's not just an excellent player, he's a true football icon. I love his playing style ‚Äì his lightning-fast accelerations and unpredictable technique. He was a complete striker: capable of coldly finishing an action, but also creating an opportunity out of nothing."

questions.title: What questions did our players ask the coach? üòä

q1.question: According to the coach, does a goalkeeper have to be a little crazy?
q1.answer: Yes, I think a goalkeeper must have a part of madness. It's a position that requires not only exceptional physical qualities, but also extraordinary psychology. This part of "madness" is courage, instinct, and sometimes almost excessive self-confidence.

q2.question: What is the greatest difficulty in working with children?
q2.answer: The greatest difficulty, for me, is meeting the needs of very different personalities. Each child is unique ‚Äì some need more attention, others challenges, still others support and patience.

q3.question: Favorite book and why?
q3.answer: I don't have a particular favorite book, but what fascinates me most are books about special units and military missions. I'm fascinated by the determination and discipline required to serve in these units.

dominika.name: DOMINIKA K≈ÅOSOWSKA
dominika.tagline: The youngest of the coaching team‚Ä¶ and the favorite of the female section of players

formations.title: Training courses, workshops, licenses obtained
formations.women: Specialized training on women's football with Marzena Bogdanowicz
formations.intro_uefa: Introductory training to UEFA C curriculum
formations.uefa_progress: In progress: UEFA C Training ‚Äì fingers crossed! üòäüí™

mottos.title: Life mottos
mottos.motto1: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
mottos.motto2: It's not always the strongest, fastest or most talented who wins ‚Äì it's the one who thinks they can do it.
mottos.motto3: If you can dream it, you can do it.

idol.title: Idol: Cristiano Ronaldo
idol.text: Always Cristiano Ronaldo, since childhood, and it will never change. CR7 embodies iron discipline, rigor, constancy for me. His success comes not only from talent, but from hard work, a spirit of sacrifice, an incessant quest for perfection.

questions.title: Players asked the coach a few questions üòä

q1.question: What gives the most joy in working with children?
q1.answer: After a year of training at Olympique, I can say that all the children have totally adopted me. The most beautiful moment? It's when, after a difficult day, I arrive on the field with all the equipment and I hear: 'Oh hello Coach! We were really looking forward to this moment with you!' These words and the positive energy of the children immediately erase the fatigue.

q2.question: How do you live working in a so-called 'men's profession'?
q2.answer: Working in a 'men's world' is a real challenge. Despite the progress of women's football, it is still perceived as a male sport. Female coaches remain rare, even precious. But I've always had so-called 'masculine' interests, and I've always been comfortable in groups of men.

q3.question: What would she like to change in football?
q3.answer: Football is a beautiful sport, but it needs to evolve on several points: offer the same opportunities to women, promote women's football more, strengthen respect in sport, reduce absurd salaries, and a more equitable distribution of funds.

jakub.name: JAKUB GOLA≈ÉSKI
jakub.tagline: Respect and motivation in one person
jakub.motto: Work in silence, let results make noise

formations.title: Courses, training, workshops, licenses obtained
formations.bachelor: Bachelor's degree in physical education with corrective-compensatory gymnastics
formations.ajax: Camp for Ajax Amsterdam coaches in Krakow

idol.title: Football idol
idol.text: Ronaldo Luis Nazario de Lima ‚Äì according to Coach Jakub ‚Äì one of the best strikers in the world, possessing exceptional individual skills, a man who knew how to come back stronger after injuries.

passion.title: Other passion than football
passion.text: A good detective novel, personal development, travel

questions.title: Our players asked the coach a few questions üòä

q1.question: What was the first club where the coach became a coach and why?
q1.answer: The first club where I worked as a coach was Z≈Çoci Z≈Çotkowo. I was approached by one of the local residents to create training sessions for children and that's how my coaching adventure began.

q2.question: What should we pay particular attention to when training young people?
q2.answer: I think the main aspect of young players' development is individual actions in attack and defense. It's important to instill in the child a love of sport!!!

q3.question: Some tips for charming a girl
q3.answer: Self-confidence and being yourself are important. Conversation ‚Äì women love to be listened to. Ask questions, be interested in what she says. Remember the name of the girl!!!! who interests you. Weird phrases like 'you shine like a million coins' are not appropriate.

pawel.name: PAWE≈Å KULESA
pawel.tagline: Trainer with a relaxed style but professional approach
pawel.motto: Be the hero of your own movie

formations.title: Courses, training, workshops, licenses obtained
formations.conferences: Participation in conferences and training improving skills

idol.title: "Childhood" football idol and current favorite player
idol.text: Child: the coach's brother - Karol Morawiec - "...who showed me football as a child, I always wanted to watch how he played and kick the ball with him even for just 5 minutes". The second idol is the coach's later trainer - Tomasz Kici≈Ñski - "...at the time when I was actively playing, I always watched him in the 3rd league. I remember as if it were yesterday his long-range goals and his almost golden long hair, thanks to which he stood out as much as by his skills. Later, he trusted me at 16 and introduced me to the senior team. I still remember him, a wonderful man". Currently, favorite player is Konrad Laimer - Bayern Munich and John Stones - Manchester City.

passion.title: Other passion than football
passion.text: Loves sport in the broad sense, gym, running, tennis. Everything related to sport even if, as he said himself, "It may not show". A great passion, enthusiasm is cooking "I love cooking for my family (they say I missed my calling)".

favorite_club.title: Favorite football club
favorite_club.text: Legia Warsaw - "...thanks to my brother Karol, I've been supporting the capital's club for x years. However, this season, I'm counting on the championship for Lech!" and the foreign club Arsenal London

questions.title: What did our players want to know about the coach? üòä

q1.question: Favorite coach in the world and why?
q1.answer: I have two: 1. Jurgen Klopp - The Normal One, because he is himself and is a distinctive person in coaching while maintaining an appropriate work-life balance. 2. Jakub Gola≈Ñski - for his professional approach to his responsibilities and because at the time of my "burn-out", he had a huge influence in reigniting that flame.

q2.question: What would the coach say to his younger self? What life advice?
q2.answer: Fear is a normal reaction to certain situations. Learn to control it so that it is a positive fear that fuels your actions and not paralyzing. It's only football, have fun and show what you can do without any barriers.

q3.question: Why Olympique Pozna≈Ñ? What would the coach change in the club's current operation?
q3.answer: The training approach consistent with mine. It's not age but current skills that should determine who we compete with. What would I change? Everything and nothing. Everything that requires changes for the good of the children, whatever it is and will be. And nothing because it's a wonderful community that puts children and young people first.

accompagnement.title: A family united by passion
accompagnement.paragraph1: At the heart of our club: every child deserves their chance.
accompagnement.paragraph2: We help children grow, believe in themselves, get back up. Our coaches listen, encourage, transmit.
accompagnement.highlight: From first steps on the field to senior matches, Olympique Pozna≈Ñ accompanies each player on their journey.

performance.title: Higher. Stronger. Prouder.
performance.paragraph1: On our fields, children learn to surpass themselves. Against doubt, fatigue, fear of failure.
performance.paragraph2: Our coaches support them to transform effort into pride, perseverance into results.
performance.highlight: Whether you're 4 or 70 years old, our fields are there to reveal your potential. Because tomorrow's champions are built in today's training sessions.
